memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1503

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
directing the state liquor authority to exempt not-for-profit companies
from the fifteen day billing cycle

PURPOSE:
This bill would mandate that the NYS Liquor Authority return to the"
30 day billing policy" for not-for-profit organizations.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Adds section one which would state that the commissioners of the
state liquor authority are hereby directed to allow all
not-for-profit establishments that are subject to the regulations of
the authority at least 30 days for all billing procedures.

JUSTIFICATION:
The New York State Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control has issued a
memorandum mandating a policy of billing all retail sales
establishments twice a month for all purchases from all beer, wine
and liquor distributors. A large number of the American Legion Posts
in New York State operate a members' lounge which significantly
contributes to the income and social activities of the facility. The
operation of such members' lounge is under the jurisdiction of the
New York State Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control. The current
billing policy is a major deviation from the normal practice of a 30
day net due policy utilized universally by the retail business
community throughout this State and Nation. This policy, for many
obvious reasons, constitutes discrimination and hardship against a
specific business sector in which many participants such as the
American Legion, are small, nonprofit organizations whose book-
keeping and financial transactions are performed by volunteers.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10 - S.3170/A.7527 - Investigations/Gov. Ops. Comm./Economic
Development Comm.
2008 - S.6008/A.5006 Investigations/Gov Ops. Comm./Economic
Development Comm.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediate.
